meanings.definition: To give someone the responsibility of doing something or of caring for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She entrusted her best friend with the task of feeding her cat while she was away.
meanings.sent2: The teacher entrusted the students with the important job of taking care of the class pet.
meanings.sent3: He entrusted his mischievous little brother with the secret of where he hid his candy.
meanings.sent4: The captain entrusted the young sailor with steering the ship through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The king entrusted the loyal knight with protecting the kingdom from invaders.

meanings.sent1: The mother entrusted her daughter with the family heirloom necklace.
meanings.sent2: She entrusted her best friend with the key to her diary.
meanings.sent3: He entrusted his clumsy friend with carrying the fragile vase to the other room.
meanings.sent4: The scientist entrusted the assistant with the top-secret formula for the new invention.
meanings.sent5: The coach entrusted the star player with leading the team to victory.
